citations.narrative:
Five 7-month old juvenile cats lacked permanent identification. The kittens still had litter cards identifying them attached to
their cages. Additionally, despite having records that the remaining cats were microchipped as their permanent
identification, the microchip reader was unable to find the microchips on at least 3 other cats that were scanned.
Permanent identification is required to track ownership and movement of animals to ensure their welfare. Correct by
providing either legible permanent identification or a reliable method to read permanent identification to all animals over
the age of 16 weeks by April 1, 2024.

Six juvenile cats were not recorded on the AHPIS Form 7005, Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand. Five
cats, who were approximately 7-months old, and a sixth cat, who was approximately a year old, were born on site and still
had litter records attached to their enclosures as their record of acquisition. Additionally, 2 cats were still listed as being on
site on the Acquisition Record, despite being recently re-homed. Updated and accurate records are necessary to track
ownership of animals and facilitate thorough inspection by APHIS officials. Correct by updating records to accurately
reflect current animals on hand by March 15, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Five 7-month old juvenile cats lacked permanent identification. The kittens still had litter cards identifying them attached to 
their cages. Additionally, despite having records that the remaining cats were microchipped as their permanent 
identification, the microchip reader was unable to find the microchips on at least 3 other cats that were scanned. 
Permanent identification is required to track ownership and movement of animals to ensure their welfare. Correct by 
providing either legible permanent identification or a reliable method to read permanent identification to all animals over 
the age of 16 weeks by April 1, 2024. 
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Six juvenile cats were not recorded on the AHPIS Form 7005, Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand. Five 
cats, who were approximately 7-months old, and a sixth cat, who was approximately a year old, were born on site and still 
had litter records attached to their enclosures as their record of acquisition. Additionally, 2 cats were still listed as being on 
site on the Acquisition Record, despite being recently re-homed. Updated and accurate records are necessary to track 
ownership of animals and facilitate thorough inspection by APHIS officials. Correct by updating records to accurately 
reflect current animals on hand by March 15, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
